summary: This document appears to be notes from a WebEx meeting with Janine Gill, an HR Director for Trump Florida properties, discussing employment record retention practices and reviewing a specific file (USVP1148). The discussion covers how long files are kept, the types of documents contained within them, and the processes for updating employee information.

persons.role: HR Director for Trump Florida properties
persons.context: Participant in a WebEx meeting discussing employment record retention practices at Mar-a-Lago, Trump International, and Trump National. She reviews the contents of a specific employee file (USVP1148).

events.title: Janine Gill's employment start date
events.description: Janine Gill began working at Mar-a-Lago, Trump International, and Trump National.

events.title: WebEx meeting with Janine Gill
events.description: A WebEx meeting was held with Janine Gill to discuss employment record practices and review a specific file (USVP1148).

keyFacts: Janine Gill has worked as HR Director for Mar-a-Lago, Trump International, and Trump National since January 2, 2007.
Mar-a-Lago typically keeps employment files for 7-10 years, but some older paper files are kept longer, especially if litigation is known.
A specific employee file, USVP1148, was reviewed during the meeting; it contains employment, payroll, and medical documents and is slated to be purged soon.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating it is part of a legal proceeding.
